body: Adding any valid `--log-file=` argument allows rclone to start.
`rclone serve --stdio` launched by `restic`/`resticprofile` within a systemd service is unaffected while directly launching `rclone serve --stdio` as a systemd-service seems affected.
Thanks for making this issue @m0gg . That commit is exactly the one I thought it would be! I'll investigate now.

Can you give this a try @m0gg this should fix the problem and hopefully the logs will look as they did before.

[v1.71.0-beta.8801.3314f9fa0.fix-8621-systemd-logging](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8621-systemd-logging/v1.71.0-beta.8801.3314f9fa0.fix-8621-systemd-logging/) on branch [fix-8621-systemd-logging](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8621-systemd-logging) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Built it locally and tested. Looks good again. Thank you very much!

Thanks for testing @m0gg 

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.71 - I'll also put it in v1.70.2
This has now been released in v1.70.2

issue.title: Feature implementation from commits 898a590..fe62a2b

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
# PR Summary

Enhanced Logging, Windows Junction Support, and String Transformation Improvements

## Overview

This PR adds structured logging functionality to multiple commands, improves Windows junction point handling, enhances the Mega backend with TLS compatibility, and adds new string transformation options for handling multi-byte characters.

## Change Types

| Type         | Description                            |
|--------------|----------------------------------------|
| Enhancement  | Added structured logging to copy, copyto, move, moveto commands |
| Enhancement  | Added new string transformation options for truncation with UTF-8 support |
| Bugfix       | Fixed Windows junction point handling by treating os.ModeIrregular as symlinks |
| Enhancement  | Added TLS compatibility for Mega storage endpoints |
| Refactor     | Standardized logging implementation across commands |
| Bugfix       | Fixed parameter consistency in combine.go |
| Documentation| Corrected comments and improved help text in multiple files |

---

## Affected Modules

| Module / File          | Change Description                       |
|------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| `combine/combine.go`   | Fixed parameter consistency in listP call |
| `local/local.go`       | Added Windows junction point handling     |
| `mega/mega.go`         | Added TLS compatibility for Mega endpoints |
| `copy/copy.go`         | Added structured logging functionality    |
| `copyto/copyto.go`     | Added structured logging and context management |
| `move/move.go`         | Added structured logging and context management |
| `moveto/moveto.go`     | Added structured logging and context management |
| `sync/sync.go`         | Refactored logging implementation and added optimization |
| `log/systemd_unix.go`  | Improved systemd logging implementation   |
| `operations/logger.go` | Added NewDefaultLoggerFn function         |
| `operations/operations.go` | Enhanced move operation messages and optimizations |
| `operations/operationsflags/operationsflags.go` | Added logger configuration utilities |
| `transform/transform.go` | Added new string truncation functions with UTF-8 support |

---

## Notes for Reviewers

* The logging changes standardize how logging is implemented across commands
* The Windows junction point handling may need testing on Windows systems
* The Mega TLS compatibility adds support for older cipher suites
* The string transformation changes handle multi-byte characters properly

---

## Additional Context

* The systemd logging implementation now uses native journal.Print approach
* Early return optimizations were added to avoid unnecessary operations during dry runs
* New string transformation options include truncate_keep_extension, truncate_bytes, and truncate_bytes_keep_extension

issue.body:
# PR Summary

Unified Command Logging and Go 1.22 Compatibility Improvements

## Overview

This PR enhances the logging capabilities across multiple commands by implementing a standardized logging approach, fixes compatibility issues with Mega storage for Go 1.22, and improves code consistency and documentation.

## Change Types

| Type         | Description                            |
|--------------|----------------------------------------|
| Enhancement  | Unified logging framework implementation across commands |
| Enhancement  | Added Mega API compatibility with Go 1.22 |
| Refactor     | Standardized systemd logging implementation |
| Refactor     | Transform package type renaming and consistency improvements |
| Documentation | Updated command help text and markdown formatting |

---

## Affected Modules

| Module / File          | Change Description                       |
|------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| `copy/`, `copyto/`, `move/`, `moveto/` | Added standardized logging capabilities with proper context management |
| `operations/logger.go` | Added NewDefaultLoggerFn for centralized logging |
| `operations/operationsflags/` | New package for unified logger configuration |
| `mega/mega.go`        | Added TLS cipher suite customization for Go 1.22 compatibility |
| `sync/sync.go`        | Refactored to use standardized logging implementation |
| `log/systemd_unix.go` | Improved systemd logging with direct journal.Print |
| `transform/`          | Renamed types for consistency and improved help text generation |
| `local/local.go`      | Added Windows junction point handling |

---

## Notes for Reviewers

* The Mega storage compatibility fix adds support for an insecure cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256) which is necessary for their API but generally discouraged
* The logging changes provide consistent behavior across commands while improving resource management
* Several commands have been updated to use the new centralized logging approach

---

## Additional Context

* Fixes compatibility issue with Mega API in Go 1.22
* Provides a consistent logging framework for command operations
* Improves cross-platform consistency with Windows junction point handling
